headline: Marinated Baked Pork Chops
description: A 15-minute pork chop marinade of soy sauce, Worcestershire, and ketchup makes these oven-baked pork chops moist and flavorful for a delicious supper.

video.description: See how to make simple, saucy baked pork chops.
video.name: Marinated Baked Pork Chops

name: Marinated Baked Pork Chops

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Thoroughly blend oil, ketchup, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, and lemon juice in a small bowl.
Place pork chops in a medium baking dish. Pour 1/2 of the sauce over chops.

Bake pork chops in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Flip chop and cover with remaining sauce. Continue baking until the internal temperature of the chops reaches 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), about 30 minutes longer.

review.reviewBody: This is not a marinade. It goes on the meat right before and then during cooking. The end result tasted like watered-down barbecue sauce. Won't make again.
good, but next time no oil

I was skeptical before making this, but I threw caution to the wind. This was the best. We loved the sweetness of the sauce, and the pork chops were juicy and tender. Next, we are going to try the sauce on chicken breasts.
This is my husbands absolute favorite, he asks for it at least twice a month. I do find that letting it marinate in the sauces for about 30 minutes before baking gives it more depth of flavor.
My husband loved them! His exact words, "Save that recipe!"
Easy and delicious
followed directions but they were tough and not the flavor I expected.

I made this last night and got told - I don’t really like pork usually but this is really good! I used good quality pork chops and made sure I rested them for about 10 mins at the end. Tender, flavoursome and delicious
Not bad flavor, I used one less tblsp of vinegar, but needed more sugar. I used thick chops and would have overcooked them, took only 30-40 minutes.
I’ve made this several times. It’s easy and delicious. Even moderate calories. I use regular tomato sauce since that’s what I have in my fridge.
I use this recipe as a 24 hour marinade for grilled pork chops. Grilled on low heat for about 45 minutes and baste with remainkng marinade while on the grill. They're amazing.

Have made this using both pork chops & lamb steaks though tripled recipe. I substitute lemon juice for white vinegar & the soy sauce for sweet soy sauce. Bake in porcelain baking dish for easy cleaning. Delish! Very happy family!! Thank you!
Tender & tasty with minimal effort. Added fresh garlic to the sauce.
Love this dish and have made it many times. Simple and flavorful. One would think that since the chops are not marinated for hours there would be no flavor, but that is not the case.
was really good and easy. Didn't have a lemon so I left it out. Didn't made a difference.
Excellent and easy. Everyone loves it Double sauce to put over rice
This was very tasty. I followed the recipe exactly except I seasoned the pork chops with salt and pepper before adding the sauce. I used low sodium soy sauce since it was all I had.

I enjoyed making this recipe! Thank you for posting it. I read some of the comments and noticed that there were some variations. I like that! A recipe should be a starting place for innovation in cooking and baking.
The whole family loved these chops! Even my 13 years old who is picky about eating meat was like OMG those were soooooo good mom!!!!
No changers Perfect

I marinated the chops for 3 hours which added good flavour. Even though I drained the liquid at the half way point as other suggested, and I cooked the marinade on the stove to thicken it, the sauce still was runny - tasty, but runny. Broiling for the last 5 min is key. Hubby liked it more than I did. Good flavour, just not really a thick sauce.

This recipe is wonderful! I am a household of one, so I had two inch thick bone in chops and everything else except lemons so I had to substitute Kikkoman citrus ponzu for the lemon juice. I made the full recipe of the sauce and put my chops in a freezer bag and added all the sauce to the bag and tossed it in the fridge to marinate overnight. The next afternoon I took one chop out of the bag and drained out all the sauce, then froze the other chop in the bag for another day with a fresh batch of sauce. After bringing the chop to room temperature I slice up an onion on a sprayed baking sheet, put the chop on top of the onion, added a partially cooked sweet potato, and finished the recipe as directed except that I only cooked the chop for a total of about 35 minutes, until my instant read thermometer said it was at 140. I turned off the oven, covered the pan with foil and let it rest for 15 minutes. While it rested I steamed some green peas and dinner was wonderful! When I cook the other one I will post a picture, too impatient to do that this time!
Quick and easy
This was really good. I did marinate the chops for an hour. I added minced garlic and onion. I covered it for the first 30 minutes. I will save this marinade for pork tenderloin and maybe chicken.
Honestly wasn't all that impressed. It really didn't have much flavor.

We have made this recipe several times. I serve it with rice. I didn't make any changes to the recipe but I always double the recipe to have extra sauce to spread over rice. It is very tasty and the family always enjoys it.
It is one of our favorites. 
Thank you for sharing!
I loved this receipt!
Loved it! I used 10 pork chops and multiplied the ingredients by 4. It left plenty of sauce for the mashed potatoes to swim in!
Not terribly flavorful
I enjoy these. First time we cooked them on the grill and they turned out great. I double the recipe for the sauce and let them sit over night.

I bought a whole hog from a local farmer and ended up with A LOT of pork chops, more then I thought we would get.
My husband normlly won't touch pork chops (oh great), but with over 30 of them, I had to find a very good recipe. I also needed to find a recipe that the kids would mostly agree on. Someone always complains about something. 
They ALL loved this recipe and even went back for seconds!! Didn't even have leftovers to put away after dinner!

The only thing I did differently was to add 1/4 tsp of black pepper and I used avocado oil instead of vegetable oil, otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. This is a definite keeper! Thank you for saving me with this awesome recipe!

Tasty. But I don't know where the "marinated" fits in. I did let the chops rest on the counter for an hour before baking with the sauce on. Suppose it did marinate a tad. Will make again with a couple fixes.
I thought it was delicious. I would make it again.
I thought it was delicious. I would make it again.

Made this for dinner last night. I did add chopped garlic to the sauce. I didn't make double sauce as I only had 3 chops, but instead I did a separate batch of the sauce to use at the half way point when cooking. I had my thick boneless chops in the marinade for a day and a half. Put oven at 375, sliced a small onion thin and placed on bottom of dish, then poured the chops and sauce out on top. Covered with foil and cooked for 20 min. I didn't pour out any excess sauce at this point as there really wasn't much. Flipped over chops, poured over my extra batch of sauce, left them uncovered this time, for about 15 min, then did 5 min under broiler. They were AMAZING, even my very picky 4 yr old said "THANKS for dinner mom, it was Yummy!" We will make this again and will keep this in our regular rotation for sure. Looking forward to the fried rice that we will make with it tonight, as we had half a chop left over and some extra sauce from the pan.
We enjoyed it very much! We will be using this recipe again.
This was just okay. It certainly was fast enough to throw together but didn’t have any wow factor to it. Would I make it again? Probably.
Great! Used lower sodium soy sauce to cut down on sodium on sodium content of meal.
Very good. I actually use it as a marinade for a few hours, and then grill it.

This was very good, there was plenty of sauce for 4 good sized boneless chops. Easy and quick to put together with ingredients in my pantry--although I substituted BBQ sauce for the ketchup because we are not a big ketchup family. I thought they were a little dry (although my husband and daughter did not complain) so I think I will cover next time as others suggested, and also consider marinating the chops ahead of time.
It was a good flavored marinade. My family liked it.
Watch the cooking time as 30 minutes on each side is good for 1 inch or thicker pork chops. This marinade is delicious.
Thia was a huge success at my house! My boyfriend and i used to always just put season-all on our pork chops and wanted to change it up. these are the best chops weve ever eaten!!
This is probably one of the best ways I’ve had to make pork chops. Delicious
I also doubled the sauce recipe to use on the rice! Everyone loved it!
Delicious - sweet and tangy.

I made this for supper tonight. I made it exactly as written, but took other reviewers suggestion and doubled the sauce. I only baked them 20 minutes a side, and they were tender and juicy. The sauce was delicious, and the whole dish was quick and easy.
We enjoyed this as an alternative to bbq sauce. If you don’t lean towards a sweet sauce you could cut back a little on the sugar and be fine.
Been using this recipe now since it came out and it’s the only way I cook pork chops. Follow it to a tee.
Very flavorful but use thick chops.

I made changes based off of many of the other reviews. Definitely had to triple the marinade as it was not enough. Used white wine vinegar rather than oil. Marinaded the chops for a few hours before baking and then broiled to get them crispy. They turned out wonderful. We will be making this again.
Pork chops were moist and delicious. I baked them in the oven. We will use this again for sure!
Very easy and good tasting pork chops. Doubled marinate and served over rice
No flavor. I had 8 1” chops and had to double the sauce. Baking in the shallow dish caused them to retain too much juice which “watered” it down. Just flavorless. Won’t do again.
It has great flavor, but it was very tough.

Wanted something new for supper, and this turned out AMAZING.
I didn't have brown sugar or lemon juice, so I used white sugar and orange-mango juice. I will 100% make this MANY more times!
I doubled the recipe for 8 pork chops, and paired it with mashed potatoes and baked beans, drizzling the "juice" over everything on the plate.
Will be making it again soon . So easy an such a good sweet taste. Pork chops came out so soft an thoroughly cooked.
Will be making it again soon . So easy an such a good sweet taste. Pork chops came out so soft an thoroughly cooked.

It was great. The only thing different I did was that I used garlic infused olive oil in the sauce that I used to marinate the pork chops. I tripled the sauce so that I could have sauce to cook the pork chops and sauce to pork over the chops. I marinated the pork chops for about 6 hours. with the sauce. It took about 30 minutes to cook. I also broiled them a bit. I served them with corn on the cob and garlic mashed potatoes. There wasn't a drop of food left on the plate. Definitely a keeper.

I cooked in the oven then in a skillet for the second half of the cooking, they reached the 145 degrees quickly, I cooked until the internal temp reached 160 and they were just right. They retained the flavor of the seasoning which I modified with white sugar and orange juice since it was what I had on hand. Great recipe! Thank you.

I have made this a few times and my family likes it however we found the pork a little too tough. So this time, I boiled it first for about an hour than poured the marinade and baked and followed the recipe. This came out more delicious as the pork was a lot more tender and juicy.
I made it and my 4 year old granddaughter loved it. I will definitely make it again!!!
It is a constant in my dinner rotation. Great with garlic mashed potatoes, or cilantro lime rice

Made it tonight for dinner, I made pork steaks instead of pork chops, I have a really PICKY 13 year old eater, his 11 year old brother isn't as tough of a critic lol but their father has his bachelors in culinary and I made this for dinner tonight and they gobbled it up!! I'm not going to lie when he seen me taking out all the ingredients to make the sauce he was like what are you doing? I said mind ya business lol and when he tasted the food he was like this is great! lol.........the only things i did different was double the sauce because I am a VERY saucy cooker and added a 1 tablespoon of lemon juice instead of 1 teaspoon because I absolutely LOVE lemon juice lol.......this recipe was great and I will definitely be using again!!!!
Fantastic! I brined with salt and sugar first. Double the sauce (it's just that good). Cook 30 mins, check temp till it reaches 145°. Finish off by broiling a few mins.
Very nice, but doubled the sauce recipe
This was very good!!
You can't ask for simpler or faster. And it tastes good on top of that!

I've made this recipe so many times, it's always a hit. Definitely double the sauce, we eat it with rice and my family loves the sauce so much they pour it over the rice. Watch the pork chops since pork cooks pretty quickly. If you have a thinner cut of meat 15 min on each side will cook it through.
Recipe does not indicate how thick the chops are. I had 3/4" chops and 30 minutes total was perfect. Very tasty!
it was very tasty and I will cook it again
I used 4 thick pork chops. Doubled the sauce & covered with tin foil for the first half of cooking time.
My family loved it as is - great recipe!
I have made this recipe a few times and my husband and children can’t get enough of it!
It's a good recipe but I am playing around with the flavors to make it more on point because it's an odd combination of asian and western that doesn't quite mix.

I have always made pork loin chops with shake and bake but no matter how I cooked them they were dry and tough. I took a chance on this recipe. As I watched them cook I thought they would be tough. But they were incredibly tender and moist. Big hit with the family and me. Will definitely use this recipe next time.

The heat seemed a bit high, I'm used to "low and slow" for pork chops (275 F for 1 hour, etc). Though these tasted ok, they were definitely not as tender as I am used to. I even started to panic when I took them out because they felt so tough.

I’ve made this many times and it’s been a hit every time. I use boneless chops about 1 1/2” thick. I serve with rice and broccoli and make extra marinade to put on the rice. I’d give it six stars if I could!
Delicious! My family loved it!
Amazing. Had mash potatoes an fried in butter cabbage as side. Gluten free an delicious

I followed the recipe exactly except I only had 4 chops. My boyfriend said it was ok. I wasn't impressed. The sauce was ok but the chops didn't have any flavor at all. Definitely use an instant read thermometer, I had bone-in chops and baked 15 minutes on each side and they were almost over cooked.
Followed the recipe and loved it. Didn't need to change a thing. I will make it again. I think I will try it with chicken breast too.

I followed the reviewer "Ijustmightbecrazy" and adapted the recommended changes. I doubled the ingredients for the two chops, marinated the chops for several hours, turning several times, reduced the marinade and baked the chops at 350 degrees for40 minutes ( 2 thick bone-in chops). Perfect! Thanks for the added recommendations!
Made the marinade as written, except I tripled it. Marinated them all day...about 8 hours. They had very little taste, as pork often does.
Easy to put together on a week night. I added an onion and a tablespoon of minced garlic cuz that’s how I roll! Lol! Doubled the sauce served over rice...family loved it!
Loved it, will be making it again!!!
These were really good. My family loved them. I wouldn't changed the recipe.

I don't love pork but this was delicious. the sauce was what made it so! I used about 1 lb of meat which was four chops. there probably would have been enough sauce for 1 1/4 lb meat. I would refer to this as a sauce vs marinade, semantics aside it was very good.
I doubled the sauce after reading several reviews about not having enough sauce. I had a lot of sauce but that’s just fine with my son. Very tasty and I would definitely make again.

This was good, but lacked the flavor punch I was looking for. I doubled the sauce, and marinated the chops in a bit of it for about 8 hours, before covering them with more sauce and baking as directed. Following the advice of other reviewers, I topped the chops with a final layer of sauce and quickly broiled them at the end, for a nice glaze.

This was excellent. However, When I make it again, I would definitely cut back on the oil in the sauce. (I doubled the recipe). And drain the fat after the 1st 30 minutes. Excellent flavor but I didn’t drain the fat the first 30 minutes and it was runny. Will definitely make this again.
Marinade was pretty good, but the cook time was off and I wound up overcooking my pork chops. Pretty sure hubby said not to make again.
Made it as written. A very easy for dinner on a Sunday night with 4 center cut chops. Served them with mashed sweet potatoes.

It was a little dry, but I did like the sauce. I let the chops soak in buttermilk for a few hours. Doubled the sauce recipe. Sauced the chops and baked covered for 30 minutes, flipped chops and cook for another 20 minutes (still covered). I then drained liquid and added remaining sauce and broiled it for about 8 minutes (uncovered). I let it rest for about 10 minutes. I wouldn't mind using the sauce recipe again for something else.
Great recipe, tried it and my kids loved it.
I made it I wont cover it next time created too much liquid
I made this recipe as is. It was easy and simple to make. Taste was very good. The only thing I'd wish is that there were some way to make gravy out of the sauce.

This recipe is very good as is I’m sure, but I didn’t follow the directions exactly. I often make this sauce when I make pork chops in the slow cooker and it’s so good. I always omit the brown sugar cuz ketchup is sweet enough. I’ve never added lemon juice, that was very good. I usually add some miso paste or ginger and garlic if I have it for a little more flavor. I baked one thinly sliced chopsticks 350 for 20min per side n it was great!
Definitely will make it again, I think it needs a thicker cut pork chop, mine were thin and it cooked too much.
